DataElement.preferredName: Breast Neoplasm Item Collection Specimen Characteristic Surgical Procedure BreastAccessionCharacteristicsSurgicalProcedureNameVD
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The procedure used to obtain the biospecim(s)

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Neoplasm Item Collection Specimen Characteristic Surgical Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm of the breast parenchyma.  It can originate from the ducts, lobules or the breast adipose tissue.  Breast neoplasms are much more common in females than males. -- 2003:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid ta:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance._Surgical Procedure is a diagnostic or treatment medical procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Breast Neoplasm Item Collection Specimen Characteristic
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm of the breast parenchyma.  It can originate from the ducts, lobules or the breast adipose tissue.  Breast neoplasms are much more common in females than males. -- 2003:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid ta:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm of the breast parenchyma. It can originate from the ducts, lobules or the breast adipose tissue. Breast neoplasms are much more common in females than males.
A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Property.preferredDefinition: Surgical Procedure is a diagnostic or treatment medical procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Permission to Release DEC granted by primary curator in 8/2008.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: List of permissible values for the attribute that specifies the procedure used to obtain a biospecimen from a breast cancer patient

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which part of a lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which part of a lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of the breast, pectoral muscles, axillary lymph nodes, and associated skin and subcutaneous tissue (from MeSH).

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of one or both breasts, including the areola, nipple, axillary lymph nodes, and pectoral muscles.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery for breast cancer in which the breast, most or all of the lymph nodes under the arm, and the lining over the chest muscles are removed. Sometimes the surgeon also removes part of the chest wall muscles.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of one or both breasts, including the areola, nipple, and the majority of the axillary lymph nodes, but sparing the pectoralis major muscle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

DataElement.changeDescription: Permission to Release CDE granted by primary curator, Linda Schmandt, in 8/2008
